alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 10:10PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Rock, Brown, west central Holt, northeastern Blaine and eastern Keya Paha Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1010 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles south of Johnstown to 12 miles north of Brewster. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Bassett, Springview, Stuart, Long Pine, Newport, Johnstown, Hofeld Lake, Raven, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Moon Lake, Meadville, Twin Lakes State Wildlife Management Area, Willow Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Long Lake State Wildlife Management Area, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Duff, Pony Lake and Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 157 and 129. Highway 20 between mile markers 228 and 279. Highway 12 between mile markers 40 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Brown; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock
